Cell.Data: You're in Mexico City! (enter store) or (leave city)?
You're in the store! (take box1) or (take box2) or (leave store)?
You're outside Leon. (skip city) or (enter city)?
You're in Leon. (enter apartment) or (enter store) or (go farther)?
You're in the apartment. (search bedroom) or (leave apartment)?
You're in the store. (search cabinets) or (leave store)?
You're in the alley. (use firecrackers) or (run away)?
Talk to the farmer. (trade ammo) or (threaten farmer) or (walk away)?
You see the town. (go around) or (enter town)?
Prepare for the hike. (drink water) or (eat food) or (use machete) or (start hike)?
You have reached the end of Part 1.
You have reached the end of Part 2.
You beat the game! Have a nice day!
You turn down Main St and walk out of the city.
Inside you find a box of matches and 2L of water. You place them in your backpack, leave the store, and head out of the city.
Inside you find a flashlight and a machete. You place them in your backpack, leave the store, and head out of the city.
Deciding not to waste any more time, you turn around, leave the store, and head out of the city.
You've got water already and would rather not risk unnecessary run-ins, so you turn west and give the city a wide berth.
You haven't gotten any water and desperately need a hydration source if you're to continue on your journey. You start walking down the road and into Leon.
You crawl through the broken window and into the apartment.
You kick down the decrepit door and stumble your way into the store.
Nothing looks too interesting, so you decide to continue down the street.
You look under the bed and find some pistol ammo and firecrackers. Satisfied with your findings, you leave the bedroom, crawl back out the window, and continue down the street.
You decide the place looks pretty bare and save time by crawling back out the window and continuing down the street.
Pulling open the cabinets, you discover a unopened bottle of water and some food. This should help. After grabbing the items, you head back out of the store and continue down the street.
You decide the place looks pretty bare and save time by walking back out and continuing down the street.

You light the firecrackers and throw them over the nearest building. It causes the perfect distraction as you bolt in the opposite direction, keeping to the shadows as you go. Within 20 minutes you are back outside the city.

With nothing to distract, you simply run as fast as you can, scrambling and sliding as you go. Someone snatches at your backpack as you blaze by them and a sound follows which sounds oddly like a water bottle hitting the ground… Nevertheless, you make it out of the city alive.
Happy with the trade, the farmer happily hands over the frying pan and first aid kit. Nodding your head in thanks, you continue down the dirt road.

The farmer cowers in fear, a look of betrayal and sadness in his eyes. You open the chest and find a pistol and some food inside. Greedily you grab them and shove them into your backpack before heading down the dirt road.
You politely decline the old farmer's offer and continue down the dirt road.
You've got water to spare and no time to waste so you give the city a wide berth and continue on your way.
You need some water so you make your way into the city. An overturned truck on one of the roads has a bottle of water and a pocket knife in its remnants. You grab the items and head out of the town.
You rest up and drink some water to prepare for the strenuous journey ahead.
You rest up and eat some food to prepare for the strenuous journey ahead.
Using your machete, you're able to turn a roaming tortoise into a snack. You eat and rest, preparing for the strenuous journey ahead.

Ambitously, your begin your journey without any preparation. This is a mistake. Within hours you feel extremely weak and unable to move. Your breath gets harder to catch. As your vision begins to fade you notice several coyotes come out of the bushes and begin to circle you...
